New Records: Jason Holder took 4-7 as England were bowled out for 103
Brandon King hit an unbeaten 52 as West Indies cruised to victory
Key Match Events: England quickly found themselves in trouble after being asked to bat as Holder and Sheldon Cottrell did damage with the new ball
Brandon King and Shai Hope eased through the powerplay, smartly playing the situation and turned the chase into something of a non-event
Pre-Game Insights: Eoin Morgan insisted that he would have chosen to bat first as they aim to work on setting a total ahead of another T20 World Cup at the end of the year
Post-Match Reflections: Eoin Morgan: 'West Indies dominated the game early on. We lost early wickets, we didn't seem to adapt well enough in running, which is what you have to do when challenged like that with movement and a bit of bounce.'
Kieron Pollard: 'That's the blueprint we ask guys to put up. Really happy for the guys. To come out and win a match isn't easy, to see the young guys come out and finish it off was fantastic.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brandon King hits 52no as Windies cruise to victory in 17.1 overs
